intro: Machaerium affine, commonly known as the slender machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, which includes many plants known for their nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, compound leaves with a feathery appearance. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Machaerium affine is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
